examples: I opened the window to let in some fresh air.
The plane was flying through the air.
He has an air of confidence about him.
Eu abri a janela para deixar entrar um pouco de ar fresco.
O avião estava voando pelo ar.
Ele tem um ar de confiança.

suggested: Why did the balloon go near the needle? To get some air! (Air-ly hilarious, isn't it?)
The thought of polluted air and its effects on our health and environment can be disheartening.
It's frustrating when we can't breathe properly or have to endure smoggy, suffocating air.
Did you know that the air we breathe is actually a mixture of several gases, including oxygen, nitrogen, and carbon dioxide?
There's no specific smell associated with 'air', but the scent of fresh, clean air can be refreshing and invigorating.
The physical sensation of the wind blowing through your hair or the feeling of buoyancy while swimming in the air can be a sign of freedom and weightlessness.
The concept of air can be connected to the idea of life, breath, and energy.
